Entropy is not that. Depends on the definition of it. The original definition was simply the unavailability of energy to do mechanical work. At thermal equilibrium you cant do work so its high entropy. After the advent of statistical mechanics it became defined by micro states and macro states. A high entropy system is a system where there are a high number of micro states to a macro state is a high entropy system. So say a pressure gradient exists that is a low entropy system as energy can be transferred as the system will go towards thermal equilibrium as there are the most micro states to that macro state. It has nothing to do with how complex a system may look to a human simply the probability of a system trending towards the state, which happens to be thermal equilibrium.
Unless you are using a less physics use of the word simply meaning disorder.
Also no life does not in fact violate the second law of thermodynamics. Life on a local level does in fact decrease entropy but on a global scale actually will tend to increase it. For example if we look at the energy coming from the sun, it will come in high energy wave lengths. And eventually is released at lower energy levels. As it has been dispersed being used to make biological reactions occur.
As i see it the cancer would like all biological tissue decrease entropy at a local level and increase it in the wider universe.

The only fact i think matters in this debate is the merit of the idea of a god. As i see it, to understand my view you need to first accept a few premises, for good reason. So the important question is how someone goes about deciding the merit of an idea. First premise, the nature of reality can be known to some extent. This is first off because if you accept the opposing view you are being self contradictory as the statement there is no truth, is a paradox.
Secondly, assuming that there is some form of objective reality that it is most likely that the most efficient explanation is true. This is to make sure any hypothesis made is not unnecessarily complicated, as such a thing would be by its own definition unfounded.
So if we accept these ideas and look at the concept of god. What do we see. Well what is the purpose of god in an explanatory system. If it is to simply explain the physical laws of the universe? Well what evidence is there for the causes for the physical laws. There honestly is none so here a god would be an unfounded assumption unless already proven. What about for morality. Well that is something that can be objectively measured and has been. Morality can be explained easily by evolution, for which there is overwhelming evidence. For example incest is thought to be generally wrong because it decreases genetic diversity and leads to all kinds of issues, even if this explanation is wrong morality does not actually prove or disprove god. But we don't need to invoke a hyper specific character that has specific difficult to prove that doesn't like 'certain' aspects of your relationships. What about creation of the universe? Once again scientists are unsure over the nature of the universe before 10 to the negative 43 seconds after the big bang. Its open to interpretation also meaning there is nothing close to certainty, which is in it self not possible to reasonable get to.
None of this disproves any religion but i don't need to disprove all religious claims with certainty, simply demonstrate that a god is not a useful explanatory concept for explaining the universe making it on the current evidence extremely unlikely that a god exists. Or simply the fact that whatever it may be assuming that it does exists, which is a pointless assumption, it doesn't matter at all as we know nothing about it. Which is indistinguishable from it not existing.

Honestly its probably a fundamentally flawed study.
There is a thing called p hacking. Statistical significance is measured in a p value, which represents the chance that a given effect is completely by chance and is written as a proportion of 1. So 0.05 p value means that there is only a five percent chance that a given effect is merely by chance. P hacking is when researchers purposely manipulate data to get a certain statistical significance.
There are some methods for doing this. One is to collect data until you get enough of a p value and stop when you have. Another method is to test as many response variables as possible. Post analysis dropping or merging certain treatment groups.
As well as this statistical significance does not mean causality nor does it imply the strength of a correlation.

Inspired by true events.
A D class. Was in 914 as any good escape story begins. Fled the exit being camped by dog. Fled through air lock doors and hid with fellow scientist in side section. Dog waltzed in. Tension was high. Dramatic utterances were let loose in parting with my scientist friend as i Leroy Jenkinsed my way out, closing the door on dog's face and fled with my key card to the exit gate. The chase was afoot, the veracious mutant following in suit. I got through the exit doors nearly getting myself eaten. All the wile screeching like the 9 year old I am into my non existent mike, pleas for my life and for a suitable arrangement were i live and my pursuer gains nothing but no return on their investment and a whole lot of nothing sandwich. The elevators were in sight, one was open. I leaped in a semi dramatic manner and slammed the small red button as i had never before, that game. I panted, a pool of sweat slowly building up on my broken, cheap but all american chair. The tension eased with imaginary elevator music lightly humming in my head. The doors opened re inviting me to the real world once more. I Strolled out in the best manner any D class can hope to achieve. And was invited into the loving embrace of an self respecting Facility Guard. The honest Yankees' trusty bullet.
Truly a Greek tragedy. A story of hope, ambition and all appropriate antonyms to these terms.
The only escape i had received was death.

WRITING.TITLE: Ideas for a in game tutorial
WRITING.TEXT:
The game kind of needs a tutorial to ease new players in. SCP 698 (critical turtle) would be a good candidate for this role. Its purpose being to give advice about the objectively correct decision after five minutes of the choice occurring as long as the chooser has stayed in the vicinity of the SCP. This SCP could be giving to a new player or any player as an item that tells them what they should have done. Being part of the game you could naturally throw it away or put it in a lore related sound proof box. It would be very non intrusive.
It may be helpful also for more experienced players who don't know certain specific game mechanics. For instance some lots of players shoot d bois on site despite the fact that if the NTF or FG were to bring them back to span they spawn as the NTF. And I'm relatively sure vice versa. Another example is Larry'c chamber which for the first 16 hours of the game i personally had no idea what it did and just enjoyed watching people kill themselves to it. Mostly captured b bois. Now i just do it for the fun entirely.

I was thinking of 939 and got the number confused with 698. Also I'm fairly new to the fandom and still don't really know the names of the SCPs that well.
I'm fascinated by the idea of a patronizing carved turtle. That tells you what you should have done. It would also make an interesting game mechanic.

WRITING.TITLE: SCP's Healing rework suggestion
WRITING.TEXT:
SCP's seem like they need some form of healing and a skillful manner in which they can heal. I'm not advocating modern war shooter healing with passive healing that removes the stealthy play where you run around looking for health but allows for a come back if they manage to survive their latest encounter. I do not believe that SCP's are overpowered nor should they be under powered the entire thrill of the game is hunting down weaker players or surviving against the odd's, the game is casual and as long as it isn't insanely broken it shouldn't pose too much of an issue.
SCP106
Heals when people take damage in the pocket dimension the longer you linger the more health Larry gets incensing players to move quickly, at maybe a 2 to 1 ratio of healing after the fifty percent damage.
SCP Edit: 939
Can eat dead people, having a maximum amount of people over a period of time, healing a small amount of health every time. Maybe be able to eat 3 people for 40 health per five minutes heals over 5 seconds. It might take time to stop it happening in the heat of battle. Maybe 5 seconds to enact.
SCP049
Heals a small amount when he turns corpses into zombies. Same time as it takes to make a zombie, gains more health than 982 as he can do it less frequently but not much more as his weakness is lack of health. Maybe 50 health regain.
SCP096
Health regeneration on kill for 096 may work. If you have health over time for kills, so that it can't be endlessly spammed. To prolong your life on low health and it should be minimal health maybe 10 health. The main problem is shy guy is played so that you have prolonged periods of nothing punctuated by short periods of rapid action, were you get several kills. I can see it becoming redundant as when you need the health you will get gunned down before you can do anything either facing a large group or versing a single person wise enough to not look at you and shoot you every so often as to not enrage.
Healing over time with a cap might also work. Meaning you heal an amount over time when out of view to a capped amount of health. But that isn't skill based or particularly enjoyable.
SPC173
Not really sure about peanut. But i do know it sucks to be caught by the chaos insurgency or nine tail fox on low health. You be punished if you run off like an idiot as the peanut and run strait into the firing line but if you escape you should have a chance to recuperate and ambush your enemies.
I'm really not sure about the numbers. Its more about the ideas.
Edit: For non SCP characters the use of a med kit should take a short amount of time maybe two seconds to add a decision between shooting more and healing. As well as this you should be allowed to give items to other players directly and heal other players like in Left for Dead.
You could kind of do this in with fire and sword. You could customize your troops equipment.

Don't bother with save and exit it is easily broken, just close the game before leaving an area.

For easy doe.
Take quests and rob the quest giver. for instance transporting cattle for the guild master is an easy quest to make money kill the cattle go to the nearest town and sell the meat. The same with a tax collecting quest for a lord, take the money and run. If you don't mind losing relations with lots of NPC's of course.
You could just loot villages early game and ask for a pardon if your relations with the faction are not very low \-3 or so. Just find a border village in a distressed kingdom, most likely Swadia, near Dirhim is a good spot. Or near Halmar after an early game war. Don't bother stealing from villagers. Just loot and burn them if your at the level were you can grind sea raiders.
If you wan't enjoyment and money don't bother with productive enterprises, they break the game. especially when you have a dye work in every town, you have so much money it's hard to get rid of unless you own a town or castle and an insane garrison and army. It not very enjoyable mid game. And trade is just boring. If you are unaligned and have a reasonably large party bandits wont bother you and you can make easy profit buying from villages and selling at the towns of other factions. As long your not buying meat or expensive goods it easy profit. Grain from Swadia for 3 to 53 or so in the kingdom of Vaegirs. It is most likely only worth it if your in the shit and need money fast. A war has ended and you have an army you don't want to get rid of, trade. I wouldn't spend my time doing it though.
